#Text=II .
#Text=OUT OF THE DUST

#Text=AT thirty-four , Martin was still unmarried , and though he had not travelled far on that strange road to affluence which for some seems a macadamized boulevard , but for so many , like himself , a rough cow-path , he had done better than the average farmer of Fallon County .
#Text=To be sure , this was nothing over which to gloat .
#Text=A man who received forty cents a bushel for wheat was satisfied ; corn sold at twenty-eight cents , and the hogs it fattened in proportion .

#Text=But his hundred and sixty acres were clear from debt , four thousand dollars were on deposit drawing three per cent in The First State Bank -- the old Bank of Fallon , now incorporated with Robinson as its president .

#Text=In the pasture , fourteen sows with their seventy-five spring pigs rooted beside the sleek herd of steers fattening for market ; the granary bulged with corn ; two hundred bushels of seed wheat were ready for sowing ; his machinery was in excellent condition ; his four Percheron mares brought him , each , a fine mule colt once a year ; and the well never went dry , even in August .
#Text=Martin was -- if one discounted the harshness of the life , the dirt , the endless duties and the ever-pressing chores -- a Kansas plutocrat .
#Text=One fiery July day , David Robinson drew up before Martin 's shack .
#Text=The little old box-house was still unpainted without and unpapered within .
#Text=Two chairs , a home-made table with a Kansas City Star as a cloth , a sheetless bed , a rough cupboard , a stove and floors carpeted with accumulations of untidiness completed the furnishings .
#Text=“ Chris-to-pher Columbus ! ” exploded Robinson , “ why do n't you fix yourself up a bit , Martin ?
#Text=The Lord knows you 're going to be able to afford it .
#Text=What you need is a wife -- someone to look after you . ”
#Text=And as Martin , observing him calmly , made no response , he added , “ I suppose you know what I want .
#Text=You 've been watching for this day , eh , Martin ?
#Text=All Fallon County 's sitting on its haunches -- waiting . ”
#Text=“ Oh , I have n't been worrying .
#Text=A fellow situated like me , with a hundred and sixty right in the way of a coal company , can afford to be independent . ”
#Text=“ You understand our procedure , Martin , ” Robinson continued .
#Text=“ We are frank and aboveboard .
#Text=We set the price , and if you ca n't see your way clear to take it there are no hard feelings .
#Text=We simply call it off -- for good . ”
#Text=Wade knew how true this was .

#Text=When the mining first began , several rebels toward the East had tried profitlessly to buck this irrefragable game and had found they had battered their unyielding heads against an equally unyielding stone wall .

#Text=These men had demanded more and Robinson 's company , true to its threat , had urbanely gone around their farms , travelled on and left them behind , their coal untouched and certain to so remain .
#Text=Such inelastic lessons , given time to soak in , were sobering .
#Text=“ Now , ” said Robinson , in his amiable matter-of-fact manner , “ as I happen to know the history of this quarter , backwards and forwards , we can do up this deal in short order .
#Text=You sign this contract , which is exactly like all the others we use , and I 'll hand over your check .
#Text=We get the bottom ; you keep the top ; I give you the sixteen thousand , and the thing is done . ”
#Text=“ Well , Martin , ” he added , genially , as Wade signed his name , “ it 's a long day since you came in with your father to make that first loan to buy seed corn .
#Text=Would n't he have opened his eyes if any one had prophesied this ?
#Text=It 's a pity your mother could n't have lived to enjoy your good fortune .
#Text=A fine , plucky woman , your mother .
#Text=They do n't make many like her . ”

#Text=Long after Robinson 's buggy was out of sight , Martin stood in his doorway and stared at the five handsome figures , spelled out the even more convincing words and admired the excellent reproduction of The First State Bank .
#Text=“ This is a whole lot of money , ” his thoughts ran .
#Text=“ I 'm rich .
#Text=All this land still mine -- practically as much mine as ever -- all this stock and twenty thousand dollars in money -- in cash .
#Text=It 's a fact .
#Text=I , Martin Wade , am rich . ”
#Text=He remembered how he had exulted , how jubilant , even intoxicated , he had felt when he had received the ten dollars for the first load of wheat he had hauled to Fort Scott .
#Text=Now , with a check for sixteen thousand -- SIXTEEN THOUSAND DOLLARS ! -- in his hand , he stood dumbly , curiously unmoved .

#Text=Slowly , the first bitter months on this land , little Benny 's death from lack of nourishment , his father 's desperate efforts to establish his family , the years of his mother 's slow crucifixion , his own long struggle -- all floated before him in a fog of reverie .
#Text=Years of deprivation , of bending toil and then , suddenly , this had come -- this miracle symbolized by this piece of paper .
#Text=Martin moistened his lips .
#Text=Mentally , he realized all the dramatic significance of what had happened , but it gave him none of the elation he had expected .
#Text=This bewildered and angered him .
#Text=Sixteen thousand dollars and with it no thrill .
#Text=What was lacking ?

#Text=As he pondered , puzzled and disappointed , it came to him that he needed something by which to measure his wealth , someone whose appreciation of it would make it real to him , give him a genuine sense of its possession .
#Text=What if he were to take Robinson 's advice : fix up a bit and -- marry ?
